Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2009 07:35AM Vicki1685 wrote: Hi Katie  Yes lets stay in touch, sounds like were in the same boat at the moment. Glad to here your mum id doing well this week, reading your reply so sounds liek my mum, shes not been on her 02 as much this week and her coughing has got alot better. We saw the oncologist friday just before her 2nd chemo and he examined mum and hes said the breast tumor has shrunk 4cms on the first lot of chemo which were all over the moon about, he was really pleased with how well shes responded to the chemo-some good news at last! He was more concered about her breathing and gave her some really good cough medicen which has helped alot, if you like I can find out the name of it as it may help your mum aswell?  Mum has metastaic breast cancer- i think thats the name for it! like what the docs have advised you they have said they can control it and have also not told us how long she can fight it for, which is a good thing, as most stage 4 cancers they usualy give you a time frame. Mums not started her bone treatment yet as she needs 5 teeth out before they can start the treatment but doc didnt seem to worried about it! So if hes not worried were not worried lol  What type does your mum have? Im doing okay, still hasnt sunk in yet even tho we shaved her hair on sunday it still doesnt seem real, just trying to keep myself busy at all times, dont like to stop and think, how about you? How are you feeling? xxx
Posts.Title: Question about my mom katie2279 Love4MyMom

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2009 06:29AM Vicki1685 wrote: Hi Katie Im sorry to here about your mum, im kind of going through the same thing with my mum. We found out on the 3rd Aug that she had breast cancer which had spread to her lungs and bones, totally un expected and out of the blue! They have offered her chemo which she is due for her 2nd lot tomorrow, they have said they can control it?? what type of chemo is your mum on? My mum was in hospital for the first week with a chest infection and had fluid on her lungs which they didnt drain, and sent her home with an oxygen tank- god its noisy at night! LOL! She is coughing all the time and has been sick only twice. Last week she was okay had energy and this week shes felt really tired so i supose it really does go to show every person handles it diffrent, hope your mums feeling a little bit better now, im taking each day as it comes thats all you can do. Is she having bone treatment aswel? How old is your mum? sorry for all the questions etc its just ive searched high and low to find someone whos mum is going through kind of the same as me and here you are! I hope your okay, try and keep your head up, your not alone xxxxx
Posts.Title: Question about my mom katie2279 Love4MyMom

Posts.Content: Vicki1685 wrote: Hi Is there anyone out there who is IV which has spread to bones and lungs? Just want to know if what my mum is going through is normal.... Was amitted to hospital with a chest infection and came out with BC which had spread to her bones and lung...yes i know TOTAL SHOCK :-( Onc said chemo was her best option.......... After her first lot of chemo she was in hospital for phneumoinia (excuse the spelling!) with fluid on her luns but docs didnt want to drain it as it causes more harm than good????? .she had her 2nd lot of EC chemo last week and once again has a chest infection, been coughing so so much, has now just started to be sick with the coughin (flem more than food) intense pain in her ribs (mets on her ribs) from coughing so much, also had fluid on her lungs, is this normal for lung mets??????? # Any advise would be much appreachiated THANK YOU!!! :-) xxxx Vicki Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2009 04:27AM Vicki1685 wrote: Hi This thread sounds all very familuar, my lovley mum has BC which has spread to her bones and lungs (totally out of the blue diagnosed 2 mounths ago!) She to has awful coughing fits, and hates having to talk as she starts coughing! She to wears liners and trickles all the time bless her, onc have given her cough syrup that seems to be helping a little, she also has an oxygen tank at home which she says hels a great deal, maybe its worth asking your doc for one? Onc also said the coughing should wear off after a few rounds of chemo so far shes had 2 lots and not really noticed any change, recently shes been coughing up flem and small bits of food from were shes coughing so much, im guessing its the crap clearing of her lungs as she WAS a smoker for 20yrs I hope this info helps! :-) xxx
